com.github.nateowami.solve4x.solver

Class Number

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.nateowami.solve4x.solver.AlgebraicParticle
      • com.github.nateowami.solve4x.solver.Number

  • public class Number
extends AlgebraicParticle
    Represents a integer or decimal such as 35, 45.25, 56.36, 3.1415926535, and provides methods for adding, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing numbers. (TODO)
    Author:
    Nateowami

        Adds two Numbers and returns the result
        Parameters:
        n1 - The first Number
        n2 - The second Number
        Returns:
        A Number equal to the value of the two numbers added

      • add

        private static java.lang.String add(java.lang.String n1,
                   java.lang.String n2)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds two numbers represented by a String. This should not be confused with adding two Numbers; this only adds integer/decimal values represented by a string
        Parameters:
        n1 - The first number to add
        n2 - The second number to add
        Returns:
        The value of two numbers added
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the Strings cannot be parsed as ints or decimals. An empty String will throw an exception.

        Returns:

      • parseable

        public static boolean parseable(java.lang.String num)
        Tells if a string is a number. It must have at least one numeral followed by any number of numerals, and then (optionally) a decimal and at least on numeral.
        Parameters:
        num - The number to check
        Returns:
        If it's a number and/or fraction combination

      • GCF

        public static long GCF(long a,
       long b)
        Tells the GCF (greatest common factor, aka GCD, greatest common deviser) of a and b. Both a and b must be positive.
        Parameters:
        a - The first number.
        b - The second number.
        Returns:
        The GCF (greatest common factor) of a and b.
